oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An Evaluation of the ColiMast™ Test for Detection of Coliform Mastitis in Dairy Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gawrylash, Sally
Leslie, Ken
Archambault, Marie
Bashiri, Anna
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: clinical mastitis
pathogen
ColiMast™ test
growth media
coliform organism
mastitis treatment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Since the distribution of pathogens causing clinical mastitis varies widely among dairy herds, a rapid and accurate method of determining the type of pathogen involved would be useful. The ColiMast™ test consists of selective growth media in a vial. After incubation, a color change indicates the presence of coliform organisms. This research evaluated characteristics of the ColiMast TM test for detecting coliform organisms in clinical mastitis milk samples and as a diagnostic aid in a mastitis treatment decision-making protocol.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2002; 192
